content.description: Left most route on the River Crag face. It's an left-arching crack that's steep for the first 12 feet then eases, concludes at a stance at the end of the crack.

climbs.name: The Nob's Bobs
climbs.fa: Phx Local Climbing Friends, Matt Johnson

content.description: Corner of this face, climber's right of Manring face featuring easier climbing - a good route to warm up or to put noobs on.
Face climber's right of Crocker Corner and left of That's The Noobs Boobs

climbs.name: Crocker Corner
climbs.fa: [[James Crocker] and Phx Local Climbing Friends

content.description: Face climbing with a corner you can work with climber's right of the Yost Crack.
Absolutely sexy, classic, slightly-overhanging crack in an open-book kind of stem box. Great route, probably the most climbed at the River Crag. Super-dope.
content.protection: deep water - safe fall from anywhere on the route
content.location: Obvious slightly-more-than-vertical dihedral at the River Crag

content.description:
The River Crag has maybe the best climbing at the lake. It's almost always quiet and peaceful, the rock is good and its a wide, low slung crag with a high concentration of routes in a relatively small area. Nice combination of crack climbs, face climbs, roofs, traverses and aretes. Since there's often a current here, it's recommended not to anchor your craft somewhere nearby and swim-in, instead just keep someone aboard to man the boat and keep a lookout while the others climb. 

 This is a really cool area and Cottonwood Creek Beach is just a 1/3 mile away when you want to take a break and land somewhere.
